description: No / Driver 31 - Esteban Ocon: Competitor BWT Alpine F1 Team: Time 11:17: Session Qualifying: Fact The following Power Unit elements have been used:5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE)5th Turbo Charger (TC)5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H): All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme. InfringementBreaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Decision Required to start the Race from the pit lane. Reason The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season. This is a breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Further, the parts have been replaced without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this being a breach of Article 40.3. Therefore Car 31 is required to start the Race from pit lane in accordance with Article 40.9. Competitors are reminded that they have the right to appeal certain decisions of the Stewards, in accordance with Article 15 of the FIA International Sporting Code and Chapter 4 of the FIA Judicial and Disciplinary Rules, within the applicable time limits. Decisions of the Stewards are taken independently of the FIA and are based solely on the relevant regulations, guidelines and evidence presented.
rule_violated: Articles 28.2 and 40.3
decision_notes: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

description: Driver Max Verstappen was summoned by the stewards due to a pit lane incident during qualifying. The team claimed they assumed Car 1 had crossed the solid white line separating the fast and working lanes, but this assumption was deemed inaccurate as no wheel of Car 1 had crossed it.
rule_violated: Article 34.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations and Appendix L, Chapter IV, Article 5 b) of the International Sporting Code
decision_notes: The stewards determined that the team's assumption was inaccurate and took no further action.

decision_notes: The driver touched the orange kerb and was not required to go around the orange bollard before rejoining the track, therefore no infringement occurred.

decision_notes: Williams Racing changed the front wing/nose assembly and rear wing gurney of Car 2 under Parc Ferme without approval, breaching Article 40.3.

description: Driver 2 overtook Car 27 under Safety Car conditions at 15:22, breaching Article 55.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
penalty_given: 10 second time penalty and 2 penalty points (total of 8 for the 12 month period)
rule_violated: Article 55.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations
decision_notes: Reviewing positioning/marshalling system data, video, timing, telemetry, team radio and in-car video evidence determined Car 2 overtook Car 27 while race was under Safety Car.
source_file: 2024 Chinese Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 2 - Overtaking under Safety Car conditions.txt

description: Driver Kevin Magnussen of MoneyGram Haas F1 Team collided with Car 22 at Turn 6 and was given a 10-second time penalty.
rule_violated: Appendix L, Chapter IV, Article 2 d) of the FIA International Sporting Code
decision_notes: The Stewards reviewed positioning/marshalling system data, video, timing, telemetry, team radio and in-car video evidence and determined that Car 20 collided with Car 22 at Turn 6.
source_file: 2024 Chinese Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 20 - Causing a Collision.txt

description: Driver Nico Hulkenberg reprimanded for breaching Article 34.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations and Appendix L, Chapter IV, Article 5 d) of the International Sporting Code.
rule_violated: Article 34.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations and Appendix L, Chapter IV, Article 5 d) of the International Sporting Code
decision_notes: The driver explained that he checked if he was permitted to do so and the team (incorrectly) confirmed that he could.

description: Driver Daniel Ricciardo was found to have breached Article 55.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations by overtaking another car under Safety Car conditions.
penalty_given: 10 second time penalty and 3-grid place penalty
rule_violated: Article 55.8
decision_notes: The Stewards reviewed evidence and determined that the overtake was not justified.

description: Car 1 (Max Verstappen) caused a collision with Car 81 in turn 1 during the race.
penalty_given: 10 second time penalty and 2 penalty points
drivers_involved: Max Verstappen (Car 1) and driver of Car 81
rule_violated: Appendix L, Chapter IV, Article 2 d) of the FIA International Sporting Code
decision_notes: The Stewards reviewed video and in-car video evidence. Car 1 attempted to overtake Car 81 on the inside into Turn 1, but never got far enough alongside. Both cars collided shortly after the apex. The Stewards determine that the driver of Car 1 was wholly at fault and caused the collision.

description: Collision between Car 14 and Car 24 in turn 3 during the race. Driver of Car 14 (Fernando Alonso) deemed wholly at fault for a late overtake attempt resulting in contact.

rule_violated: Appendix L, Chapter IV, Article 2 d) of the FIA International Sporting Code
decision_notes: Stewards reviewed video and in-car video evidence. Driver of Car 14 attempted a very late overtake on the inside, never having the right to the racing line, and made contact with Car 24 at the apex.

description: Several drivers exceeded the 1:11.0 time limit between Safety Car lines during Qualifying.  Stewards reviewed data and determined no further action was necessary as drivers acted appropriately to not impede others.

decision_notes: The Stewards reviewed video, radio and in-car video evidence and determined that no further action was taken due to the driver giving back the position to Car 4 subsequently.
